bill_title: to revise the purposes for which rural electric cooperatives may be organized.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the purposes for which rural electric cooperatives may be organized. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 47-21-2 be amended to read as follows: 47-21-2. Cooperative, nonprofit membership corporations may be organized under this chapter for the purpose of supplying energy derived from any source whatsoever including but not limited to fossil fuel, sun, wind, water, and biomass fuels except solid waste and to promote and extend the use thereof in rural areas. Cooperatives may provide television service which includes multi-channel multi-point distribution systems, including those which utilize coaxial cable, and direct broadcast satellite service, and may provide programming to customers via a CATV system, as defined in § 9-35-16, in any municipality which does not have an operating CATV system. Cooperatives organized under this chapter may also provide and engage in activities such as rural, residential, commercial and industrial development, sewer service, water and waste water service, and housing development, and may engage in any lawful purpose in regard to such activities except banking and insurance. Cooperatives may be organized under this chapter for any lawful purpose except banking and insurance. Section 2. That § 47-21-62 be amended to read as follows: 47-21-62. A cooperative shall have power to may generate, manufacture, purchase, acquire, accumulate , and transmit electric energy, and to may distribute, sell, supply, and dispose of electric energy to its members, to governmental agencies and political subdivisions, and to other persons not in excess of ten percentum of the number of its members, and, provided, further, that a cooperative which acquires existing electric facilities may continue service to persons, not in excess of forty percentum of the number of its members, who are already receiving service from such facilities without requiring such persons to become members but such persons shall have the right to become members upon such terms as may be prescribed in the bylaws .

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the purposes for which rural electric cooperatives may be organized. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 47-21-2 be amended to read as follows: 47-21-2. Cooperative, nonprofit membership corporations may be organized under this chapter for the purpose of supplying energy derived from any source whatsoever including but not limited to fossil fuel, sun, wind, water, and biomass fuels except solid waste and to promote and extend the use thereof in rural areas. Cooperatives may provide television service which includes multi-channel multi-point distribution systems, including those which utilize coaxial cable, and direct broadcast satellite service, and may provide programming to customers via a CATV system, as defined in § 9-35-16, in any municipality which does not have an operating CATV system. Cooperatives organized under this chapter may also provide and engage in activities such as rural, residential, commercial and industrial development, sewer service, water and waste water service, and housing development, and may engage in any lawful purpose in regard to such activities except banking and insurance. Cooperatives may be organized under this chapter for any lawful purpose except banking, securities, and insurance. Section 2. That § 47-21-62 be amended to read as follows: 47-21-62. A cooperative shall have power to may generate, manufacture, purchase, acquire, accumulate , and transmit electric energy, and to may distribute, sell, supply, and dispose of electric energy to its members, to governmental agencies and political subdivisions, and to other persons not in excess of ten percentum of the number of its members, and, provided, further, that a cooperative which acquires existing electric facilities may continue service to persons, not in excess of forty percentum of the number of its members, who are already receiving service from such facilities without requiring such persons to become members but such persons shall have the right to become members upon such terms as may be prescribed in the bylaws . BILL HISTORY January 29 - First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 199 February 3 - Scheduled for hearing. February 3 - Passed as amended, AYES 10, NAYS 2. H.J. 255

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the purposes for which rural electric cooperatives may be organized. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 47-21-2 be amended to read as follows: 47-21-2. Cooperative, nonprofit membership corporations may be organized under this chapter for the purpose of supplying energy derived from any source whatsoever including but not limited to fossil fuel, sun, wind, water, and biomass fuels except solid waste and to promote and extend the use thereof in rural areas. Cooperatives may provide television service which includes multi-channel multi-point distribution systems, including those which utilize coaxial cable, and direct broadcast satellite service, and may provide programming to customers via a CATV system, as defined in § 9-35-16, in any municipality which does not have an operating CATV system. Cooperatives organized under this chapter may also provide and engage in activities such as rural, residential, commercial and industrial development, sewer service, water and waste water service, and housing development, and may engage in any lawful purpose in regard to such activities except banking and insurance. Cooperatives may be organized under this chapter for any lawful purpose except banking, securities, and insurance. Cooperatives proposing to provide local exchange telephone service in a rural telephone company's service area may do so only in compliance with the procedures contained in section 251(f) of the Communication Act of 1934, as amended by the Telecommunications Act of 1996. Section 2. That § 47-21-62 be amended to read as follows: 47-21-62. A cooperative shall have power to may generate, manufacture, purchase, acquire, accumulate , and transmit electric energy, and to may distribute, sell, supply, and dispose of electric energy to its members, to governmental agencies and political subdivisions, and to other persons not in excess of ten percentum of the number of its members, and, provided, further, that a cooperative which acquires existing electric facilities may continue service to persons, not in excess of forty percentum of the number of its members, who are already receiving service from such facilities without requiring such persons to become members but such persons shall have the right to become members upon such terms as may be prescribed in the bylaws . BILL HISTORY 1/29/97 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 199 2/3/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/97 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 2. H.J. 255 2/5/97 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 59, NAYS 9. H.J. 324 2/6/97 First read in Senate and referred to State Affairs. S.J. 347 2/24/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/24/97 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. S.J. 594
